item.title: Report E-2025020320
item.description:
Report E-2025020320

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-13
  • City: FONTANA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1342 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal USB. It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of Sher-wood lacquer released from 1) 5-gallon metal pail due to blocking and bracing (strap broke cargo fell over in transit). The release impacted trailer # 3191222. The terminal was in the process of cleaning and containerizing the release before the call was made to ERTS. Terminal used a 10-gallon metal drum for the waste.

item.title: Report E-2025020326
item.description:
Report E-2025020326

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-06
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 6, 2025, an incident occurred during a routine loading operation by a Veolia employee. While transferring containers onto a truck, the worker utilized a drum dolly to transport a 55-gallon polyethylene drum. Upon setting the drum down inside the vehicle, the employee observed approximately one pint of clear liquid pooling around the drum's base. Further inspection revealed a small hole at the bottom of the drum, which was the source of the leak. To contain and manage the spill, the worker promptly employed vermiculite and absorbent pads. These materials effectively prevented the liquid from spreading and facilitated the cleanup process. To ensure safe transportation to the intended facility, the compromised drum was placed inside an overpack container. This additional precaution allowed for the secure continuation of the drum's journey to its final destination.

item.title: Report X-2025020845
item.description:
Report X-2025020845

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-25T00:50:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-18
  • City: BARSTOW
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BURLINGTON NORTHERN RAILROAD HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: TILX 252173 (residue car) was found to be venting odor in the BNSF Barstow, CA yard. A BNSF responder assessed the car and found that the swing bolts were greater than hand-tight, but less than tool-tight. After opening the manway lid, there was no manway gasket present. The responder installed a new gasket and tool-tightened the swing bolts.

Report X-2025020739

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-25T00:50:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-14
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with an odor was presented to the OAKH spill office. While investigating the shipment the spill agent observed that one of the four cans was damaged on the bottom chime causing a small release. The cans all had positive closure rings, a fiberboard divider and absorbent material as dunnage. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2025020245
item.description:
Report E-2025020245

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-18
  • City: VISALIA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 18, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1789 had faulty packaging and released approximately 12-ounces of product to the lid of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to remediate the site. Crews tightened the loose cap and utilized absorbent pads to wipe down the impacted drum. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020244
item.description:
Report E-2025020244

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-17
  • City: W SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 17, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN3264 was damaged and released approximately twelve (12) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services. LC who dispatched a crew from Graymar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the trailer interior. GES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and swept them in with hand tools. GES personnel transferred the product from the damaged 275-gallon tote to a new 275-gallon tote for further shipment by the terminal. One (1) 55-gallon drum containing all spent absorbents, PPE, and cleanup debris, and one (1) 55-gallon drum containing the broken-down damaged 275-gallon tote were staged onsite as waste.

The laptop was soaked in water and placed in a salvage drum. Inner contents: Dell Laptop (Inspiron 16), MFG YR:2025, AT:4BVMH74, EX:9425374096 *NRC was contacted Incident#

item.title: Report I-2025020013
item.description:
Report I-2025020013

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-29
  • City: SAN FRANCISCO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Customer had moved seat after phone had fallen, which jammed the phone. Smoke began to form around his seat, and he alerted the crew. No fire was observed; however, smoke emitted from the device. The smoke was initially heavy. A halon and water extinguisher cleared some of the heavy smoke. TCB gloves were used to retrieve the device, and it was successfully contained, The device was placed in a Iavatory by 4R for the remainder of the flight Chemical odor Iingered in the cabin long after the event.

  • Description: 2 gallons of paint were compromised due to improper stacking. The pails were discovered to be Leaking at time of unload. The Leaking product was cleaned up with sweeping compound and placed in HM recovery drum along with the pails that were damaged.
